org.mozilla.gecko.util.publicsuffix

Class PublicSuffix

  • Object
    • org.mozilla.gecko.util.publicsuffix.PublicSuffix

  • public class PublicSuffix
extends Object
    Helper methods for the public suffix part of a domain. A "public suffix" is one under which Internet users can (or historically could) directly register names. Some examples of public suffixes are .com, .co.uk and pvt.k12.ma.us. https://publicsuffix.org/ Some parts of the implementation of this class are based on InternetDomainName class of the Guava project: https://github.com/google/guava

    • Method Detail

      • stripPublicSuffix

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public static String stripPublicSuffix(android.content.Context context,
                                                               @NonNull
                                                               String domain)
        Strip the public suffix from the domain. Returns the original domain if no public suffix could be found. www.mozilla.org -> www.mozilla independent.co.uk -> independent

      • getPublicSuffix

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public static String getPublicSuffix(@NonNull
                                                             android.content.Context context,
                                                             @NonNull
                                                             String domain,
                                                             int additionalPartCount)
        Returns the public suffix with the specified number of additional parts. For example, the public suffix of "www.m.bbc.co.uk" (with 0 additional parts) is "co.uk". With 1 additional part: "bbc.co.uk".
        Returns:
        the public suffix with the specified number of additional parts, or the empty string if a public suffix does not exist.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if additionalPartCount is less than zero.
        NullPointerException - if the Context or domain are null.
